ai.summary: Long Ashton Village Circular Walk is a demanding 21.4 km loop starting and finishing in Long Ashton Village, UK. The route combines rural lanes, bridleways and grassy paths with several ascents and descents, making it suitable only for experienced walkers. Expect undulating terrain, potential mud, gates and occasional stiles, and varying weather conditions that can affect footing.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly mixed surfaces: country lanes, muddy fields after rain, grassy paths and loose gravel. The route includes gentle to steep hill sections and several exposed stretches; footing can be uneven and slippery in wet conditions. Navigation is straightforward but some detours may occur, so a map or GPS is advisable.
ai.safety_notes: Carry adequate water and food for a long day, wear sturdy boots, and check the forecast; weather in the UK can be changeable. Dress in layers and bring a waterproof jacket; be prepared for mud, wet grass and cold winds on higher ground. Let someone know your plan and timings; carry a means of navigation and a charged mobile phone for emergencies. Respect livestock and farm gates; close gates after passage. In winter or after rain, expect slippery surfaces and longer ascent/descent.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof jacket, hat and gloves in cold/wet conditions)
Map, compass or GPS device; fully charged phone with offline maps
Headlamp or flashlight in case you finish after dark
Walking poles if desired for stability on ascents and descents
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) when daylight hours are longer and trails are firmer; the hike can be done in winter but weather, daylight and mud can make it more challenging.
